About Me

BIO

I am a Masters Student at Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, VA, in the Vibrations and Robotics Lab, where I have been working on the development of a wearable exoskeleton for full-wrist pathological tremor alleviation, advised by Dr. Oumar Barry. I worked on implementing a Model Predictive Controller for the exoskeleton, using successive linearization of the forearm-exoskeleton model at each time sample to obtain a linear state space model, and then generating an optimal input by minimizing a convex quadratic cost function. Currently, I am working on the data-driven modeling of pathological tremors.

Prior to joining Virginia Tech, I was working full-time as an Assistant Manager (Aug'20 - Jul'22) in the BGMH Supply Planning team at Flipkart Internet Pvt Ltd, Bengaluru, India, where I worked on improving various supply metrics using data analysis. I previously graduated from Indian Institute of Technology, Madras where I completed my Bachelors' Thesis at the TTK Center for Rehabilitation Research and Device Development advised by Dr. Sujatha Srinivasan. I worked on the development of a mechanism aimed to test the lifespan of polycentric prosthetic knees.

My research interests are

  • Robotics
  • Control Systems
  • Autonomous Systems
  • Artificial intelligence
